discussion.content: This should be unmanaged solution with a custom publisher.

comments.content:
Microsoft advocates for Managed Solutions to Production instances. 

There are two types of Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) solutions: managed and unmanaged. A managed solution is a completed solution that is intended to be distributed and installed. An unmanaged solution is one that is still under development or isn’t intended to be distributed. When the unmanaged solution is complete and you want to distribute it, export it and package it as a managed solution.

I would say the answer is managed with a custom publisher
The key for me is "or isn’t intended to be distributed". This is a custom solution for Lamna Healthcare and is not going to be distributed to other environments

Default solution cant be exported. The components of the lamna healthcare would be kept in an unmanaged solution with custom publisher (with unique prefix)in Dev environment. But it should be exported as managed which can then imported as managed in the PROD
for me that indicates, that it must be unmanaged. Because it has to stay in the default solution, which you can only accomplish by importing an unmanaged solution.

Healthcare keeps all components in the default solution but maintains a unique prefix. Dynamics is a non-code environment. This detail indicates that you have to use a managed solution with a custom publisher. C is the correct answer.

It's A - Import an UNMANAGED solution with a DEFAULT publisher

They use default solution - unmanaged (because default solution can be exported only as unmanaged)
They have unique prefix - DEFAULT publisher (You will ask why not custom? Because they use default solution - so default publisher as well. You can change prefix for default publisher, there is no need to have custom publisher to have unique prefix :))

You are right HABIBI
Default Solution --> Unmanaged
Default Solution --> Default publisher

Correct. People think it needs to be custom publisher to have unique prefix but it not correct. They use default solution, so default publisher as well. Prefix can be changed for default solution, check: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/change-solution-publisher-prefix?view=op-9-1

discussion.content: I think it should be A. You can't change the Publisher on Default Solution, however you can change the Prefix on the Default Publisher record itself.
C. Import a managed solution with a custom publisher.

The Default Solution can’t be exported. Therefore, you can’t distribute the Default Solution to another environment.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/use-solutions-for-your-customizations

Default Solution --> Unmanaged
Default Solution --> Default publisher

Default solution cannot be exported. For exporting to PROD , the components of the lamna healthcare would be kept in an unmanaged solution with custom publisher (with unique prefix)in Dev environment. But it should be exported as managed which can then imported as managed in the PROD. 
I would say the answer is managed with a custom publisher
You can't change the Publisher on Default Solution, and you can't export defaut solution as managed =­> the answer is A : Import an unmanaged solution with a default publisher

You can change the prefix of the default solution so it is A, Unmanaged (since she is working with the default solution) and default publisher (since she uses the default solution, she has changed the default prefix).

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/solutions-overview

This also says managed are only used for imports into other organisations, which isn't the case here so it would be unmanaged default solution

Very interesting, Ive never seen anyone using managed solutions for deployments to Production of any iterated customizations BUT on a newly updated documentation Microsoft is suggesting to use Managed. I find this odd....
"In the Package Type step, you must choose whether to export the solution as an Unmanaged or Managed solution. Unmanaged solutions are intended to be used to transport configuration from one development environment to another or to check into your source control system. Managed solutions are intented to be used to transport configuration to all other environments including test and production environments."
You can't change the publisher for the default solution. You also can't export the default solution as a managed solution. So it has to be A.

comments.content: You need to move changes to the production environment. on production recommendation is managed solution
I would go for this option again I am not able to export default solution also

discussion.content: Why not A? The Default solution can be exported and it is forced as an unmanaged solution. For the publisher, you cannot change the default publisher, but you can change its prefix, that would fit the requirement. That would be an easy way to handle all of this, you will be ensured that the production = sandbox (no missing component, no unmanaged local customization in production would be kept). Am I wrong?

I think this is D. Keeping all components in default solution means when moving changes to production, you can only export default solution and install default solution as an unmanaged solution file. You cannot change publisher for default solution and prefix is only changed by clicked the publisher and changing that!

Default solution (as given in the requirement) can't be exported as managed! So the answer is unmanaged solution.

Now I checked it now.. and it's possible to change prefix for the default publisher to whatever you want, though it's not possible to change the default publisher itself for the default solution.. So the question must have more clarity and is ambiguos.
Being forced to choose one, I would have chosen "unmanaged solution with a custom publisher.".. as proposed by JNSNW
Why not Managed solution with a default publisher ? Managed solution is completed solution for install, and the customer hold everything inside of default solution...Any suggestion ?

“Install an unmanaged solution only if you want to add all the components to your default solution and overwrite any existing customizations.”
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/solutions-overview
So I vote for C
I will go for D. Import an unmanaged solution with a custom publisher.

comments.content: I don't believe the custom publisher is needed (see my reply to AlexR above).

discussion.content:
What about this statement ' simplify management of Dynamics 365, Lamna
Healthcare keeps all components in the default solution but maintains a unique prefix'

comments.content:
Healthcare keeps all components in the default solution = UNMANAGED
 but maintains a unique prefix. = CUSTOM PUBLISHER
 Dynamics is a non-code environment. = So no need for Managed

I think it's A, Unmanaged with default publisher. Why?

Unmanged because as you said the Default Solution (in which she does her work) can only be exported as unmanaged. However, for her prefix, no custom publisher is needed unless she's doing additional development in the production environment. Why? You cannot change which Publisher is associated to the Default Solution (in which she works), it is always the default publisher. But you CAN change the prefix on the default publisher record, which is implied she has already done. When she exports the default solution, all her existing customizations will include her custom prefix.

discussion.content:
You really want to let users take control of the production environment?
"Oh, you just need to not give system admin Security Role to users" and then receive an email of the Sales Manager asking you to have this access with the vice president in CC.
Managed Solutions with Custom publisher guys!

questions.question_text:
You need to move changes to the production environment.
What should you do?

choices.C: Import a managed solution with a custom publisher.
choices.D: Import an unmanaged solution with a custom publisher.
choices.A: Import an unmanaged solution with a default publisher.
choices.B: Import a managed solution with a default publisher.
